title: 20 Injured in Russia Passenger Train Crash
content: At least 20 people were injured after a passenger train derailed in Russia's Far North on Wednesday, authorities said.
summary: At least 20 people were injured after a passenger train derailed in Russia's Far North on Wednesday, authorities said.

title: 95-Year-Old "Nazi Grandma" Convicted Again For Denying Holocaust
content: A notorious German pensioner known as the "Nazi grandma" who has been jailed several times for denying the Holocaust was sentenced to another 16 months at her latest trial on Wednesday.
summary: A notorious German pensioner known as the "Nazi grandma" who has been jailed several times for denying the Holocaust was sentenced to another 16 months at her latest trial on Wednesday.

title: Princess Anne In Hospital With Minor Injuries, Husband Shares An Update
content: King Charles III's sister Princess Anne is "recovering slowly" in hospital, her husband said Wednesday, after she suffered a concussion in an incident with a horse at her country estate.
summary: King Charles III's sister Princess Anne is "recovering slowly" in hospital, her husband said Wednesday, after she suffered a concussion in an incident with a horse at her country estate.

title: US Says Julian Assange, Now Free, Had Put People In Danger
content: The US State Department on Wednesday renewed its allegation that WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange put people at risk for revealing secrets, after he was freed in a plea deal.
summary: The US State Department on Wednesday renewed its allegation that WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange put people at risk for revealing secrets, after he was freed in a plea deal.

title: Amazon Plans Discount Section That Ships Directly From China: Report
content: Amazon.com plans to launch a section on its shopping site featuring cheap items that ship directly to overseas consumers from warehouses in China, the Information reported on Wednesday, citing slides shown to Chinese sellers.
summary: Amazon.com plans to launch a section on its shopping site featuring cheap items that ship directly to overseas consumers from warehouses in China, the Information reported on Wednesday, citing slides shown to Chinese sellers.

title: Kenya's U-Turn Over Tax Hikes After 22 Die In Violent Protests
content: Kenyan President William Ruto said Wednesday that a bill containing contentious tax hikes would "be withdrawn", dramatically reversing course after more than 20 people were killed in clashes with police.
summary: Kenyan President William Ruto said Wednesday that a bill containing contentious tax hikes would "be withdrawn", dramatically reversing course after more than 20 people were killed in clashes with police.

title: Sri Lanka Seals Debt Deal As It Recovers From 2022 Financial Crash
content: Sri Lanka said on Wednesday it had clinched a restructuring deal with India, China, and other nations, covering up to $10 billion in debt, a critical step towards recovery after a 2022 financial crash.
summary: Sri Lanka said on Wednesday it had clinched a restructuring deal with India, China, and other nations, covering up to $10 billion in debt, a critical step towards recovery after a 2022 financial crash.

title: Biden-Trump Presidential Debate Tomorrow: Biggest Moment So Far In US Polls
content: Joe Biden and Donald Trump prepared Wednesday for the biggest moment so far in the US election -- the first of two high-stakes debates that could upend the race.
summary: Joe Biden and Donald Trump prepared Wednesday for the biggest moment so far in the US election -- the first of two high-stakes debates that could upend the race.

title: Cash-Strapped Pakistan Likely To Privatize National Flag Carrier: Report
content: Cash-strapped Pakistan is likely to privatize its national flag carrier by the first week of August, a media report said on Wednesday.
summary: Cash-strapped Pakistan is likely to privatize its national flag carrier by the first week of August, a media report said on Wednesday.

title: Scientists Develop Speech Recognition Tool To Predict Alzheimer's Onset
content: A new AI-based model could predict the onset of Alzheimer's disease by analysing an individual's speech, the developers said.
summary: A new AI-based model could predict the onset of Alzheimer's disease by analysing an individual's speech, the developers said.

title: "Let's Sit Down And Talk": Pakistan PM Extends Olive Branch To Imran Khan
content: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Wednesday extended an olive branch to his predecessor and political rival Imran Khan, offering to hold talks with him if was facing "troubles" in jail.
summary: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Wednesday extended an olive branch to his predecessor and political rival Imran Khan, offering to hold talks with him if was facing "troubles" in jail.

title: US Security Body Seeks Pact With India To End Rescreening Of Passengers
content: The US transport security body has sought a unique "one-stop agreement" with India to end the rescreening of passengers, asserting that the "really powerful" concept will raise global aviation security standards.
summary: The US transport security body has sought a unique "one-stop agreement" with India to end the rescreening of passengers, asserting that the "really powerful" concept will raise global aviation security standards.

title: Video: Tesla Car Flips 7 Times After Crash, All Passengers Survive
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has reacted to a video showing a terrifying accident involving his company's Model Y car.
summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has reacted to a video showing a terrifying accident involving his company's Model Y car.

title: US Says Committed To Partnering With Maldives To Ensure Free Indo-Pacific
content: The US has reaffirmed its commitment to partnering with the Maldives to promote a free, open, and secure Indo-Pacific region, a senior state department official has said, amidst the archipelagic nation in the Indian Ocean moving closer to China.
summary: The US has reaffirmed its commitment to partnering with the Maldives to promote a free, open, and secure Indo-Pacific region, a senior state department official has said, amidst the archipelagic nation in the Indian Ocean moving closer to China.

title: Volleyball Player, Jailed For Raping A Minor, To Compete At Paris Olympics
content: Steven van de Velde was sentenced in March 2016 to four years in prison after admitting to three counts of rape against a child he met on Facebook
summary: Steven van de Velde was sentenced in March 2016 to four years in prison after admitting to three counts of rape against a child he met on Facebook

title: Russia Begins Closed-Door Trial For US Reporter On Spy Charges
content: A shaven-headed Evan Gershkovich went on trial behind closed doors on Wednesday in a Russian court where the US journalist is facing accusations of espionage.
summary: A shaven-headed Evan Gershkovich went on trial behind closed doors on Wednesday in a Russian court where the US journalist is facing accusations of espionage.

title: Julian Assange's Wife Requests Privacy: "He Needs To Recuperate"
content: Wikileaks founder Julian Assange needs privacy and time to recover after more than five years in a high-security London prison, his wife Stella said Wednesday.
summary: Wikileaks founder Julian Assange needs privacy and time to recover after more than five years in a high-security London prison, his wife Stella said Wednesday.

title: Secret Talks In US Led To Julian Assange Deal, Says Australia PM
content: Australia's Prime Minister said Wednesday a string of recent non-disclosed missions to the United States helped to forge the plea deal that freed Julian Assange.
summary: Australia's Prime Minister said Wednesday a string of recent non-disclosed missions to the United States helped to forge the plea deal that freed Julian Assange.

title: How Australia's Quiet Diplomacy Led WikiLeaks' Julian Assange To Freedom
content: After Julian Assange was released by a court on the remote US Pacific territory of Saipan, ending a 14-year legal battle, the WikiLeaks founder's lawyer first thanked Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese for making the outcome possible.
summary: After Julian Assange was released by a court on the remote US Pacific territory of Saipan, ending a 14-year legal battle, the WikiLeaks founder's lawyer first thanked Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese for making the outcome possible.

title: Tensions Between Music Labels And Generative AI Reach US Courts
content: Some of the world's biggest music production companies, including Sony Music Entertainment, are suing two US-based artificial intelligence (AI) platforms Suno and Udio that generate songs based on text prompts, news agency Associated Press reported.
summary: Some of the world's biggest music production companies, including Sony Music Entertainment, are suing two US-based artificial intelligence (AI) platforms Suno and Udio that generate songs based on text prompts, news agency Associated Press reported.
